content.title: AICTE - YOUTH UNDERTAKING VISIT FOR ACQUIRING KNOWLEDGE (YUVAK): STUDY TOUR OF ATAL TUNNEL, HIMACHAL PRADESH
content.details: AICTE has launched a new scheme namely, AICTE YOUTH UNDERTAKING VISIT FOR ACQUIRING KNOWLEDGE (YUVAK) STUDY TOUR OF ATAL TUNNEL, HIMACHAL PRADESH, on 21st May 2021 to provide financial grants to the team of one faculty and 10 students from AICTE approved institutions for the study tour of ATAL TUNNEL.
benefits: Train Fare from Institute to Chandigarh & back: ₹30,000/- for NRO & NWRO, ₹60,000/- for Other Regions
Transport charges from Chandigarh to Manali (including visits to ATAL Tunnel) & back: ₹30,000/- for NRO & NWRO, ₹30,000/- for Other Regions
Boarding & Lodging and incidental expenses at Manali for 03 days: ₹1,10,000/- for both regions
Total Grant Amount: ₹1,70,000/- for NRO & NWRO, ₹2,00,000/- for Other Regions
eligibility: AICTE approved Institutions in the field of Technical Education having latest NIRF ranking between 001 to 500 are eligible for the grant.
Team of 10 Students + 1 Faculty member of each eligible Institute.
content.application_process: Offline. AICTE approved Institutions having NIRF ranking between 01 to 500 & fulfilling the eligibility Criteria, can submit their applications online as per the notification available time to time on the AICTE portal.
documents_required: Details of faculty member going as team leader

faqs.question: What is AICTE – Youth Undertaking Visit For Acquiring Knowledge (YUVAK) Study Tour Of Atal Tunnel scheme?
faqs.answer: AICTE–Youth Undertaking Visit For Acquiring Knowledge (YUVAK) Study Tour Of Atal Tunnel scheme has been launched to provide financial grants to the institutions who conducts study tour of ATAL TUNNEL to the team of one faculty and 10 students from AICTE approved institutions.

faqs.question: When this scheme was launched?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched on 21st May, 2021.

faqs.question: Who manages this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

faqs.question: What is Atal Tunnel and where it has been built?
faqs.answer: Atal Tunnel has been built under the Rohtang Pass on the Leh-Manali Highway as an all-weather route to Leh and Lahaul and Spiti valleys. At a length of 9.02 km, it is the longest tunnel above 10,000 feet (3,048 m) in the world and is named after former Prime Minister of India, Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the scheme is to gain firsthand knowledge & information about the latest techniques used in construction of the tunnel and in particular about the New Austrian tunneling method.

faqs.question: What should be the criteria of the institution?
faqs.answer: AICTE approved Institutions in the field of Technical Education having latest NIRF ranking between 001 to 500 are eligible for the grant.

faqs.question: Maximum how many Institutions from NRO & NWRO regions will get the benefits?
faqs.answer: Grant will be for a maximum of 25 Institutions from NRO & NWRO regions in a financial year.

faqs.question: Maximum how many Institutions from remaining regions will get the benefits?
faqs.answer: Grant will be for a maximum of 75 Institutions from remaining regions in a financial year.

faqs.question: How many proposal per Institute will be accepted during the entire duration of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only ONE proposal per Institute will be accepted during the entire duration of the scheme.
